text: As we hear "What is Love" by HADDAWAY -- night falls and  partytime begins.
Coconut Teaser, The Palace, The Roxbury, Tatou, etc.
Of random dancers -- gyrating, flirting, making out, drin
The CAMERA MOVES THROUGH a crowded dance floor -- and  SETTLES ON the rhythmically swaying backs of...

Our heroes.  In their minds, Steve is tall, dark and hand -- except for the tall and little part.  They simultaneously turn and scope the room.  In unison,  their heads bop to the MUSIC.  Doug steps out from the  bar.
(to O.S. female)  Hey!  You want to dance?  No?  Yes?  Alright, don't worry about  it.
Doug, rejected, steps back as Steve steps out.
(to O.S. female)  Do you want to dance?  You do?  You don't?  Not a problem.
They are no strangers to rejection, so neither is fazed.  Doug enthusiastically steps towards two attractive girls.
Hey, you wanna...?
Two attractive girls turn their backs to Doug.
(remaining positive)  No?  Maybe I'll see you later.
Doug steps back.  Steve spots GIRL AT end of BAR and  dances over to her.
Hey, do you want to dance?
No.
(cheerfully)  Alright, you know where I'll be.
Steve steps back.  Doug sees a pretty woman on a balcony, waving to someone.
(pointing to each other)  You want him?  Me?  Him?  Me?
Pretty woman waves them off, frustrated, and dissapears.
... Oh, you're okay?
Alright then.
They turn around to the bar, bartender is standing in  front of them.
Bartender, can I get a beer?
The bartender pays no attention and walks away.  Second  bartender comes from the opposite direction.
Barkeep, what do you have on tap?
The second bartender ignores them, walks away.  The  bartenders keep crossing past the, paying no attention.
Big guy, could I get a...
My man, how 'bout a...
S'cuse me, partner...
Yo, buddy, I was wondering... you  know what?  Don't worry about it.
Yeah, we're good.

They turn back to the dance floor and bop.  Suddenly, a  HOT GIRL dances in front of them.  Doug dances up behind her and frantically gyrates.  She  turns away -- only to find...  Steve gyrating behind her.  The guys close in on her  trapping her in the middle.
Get off me!
She runs off, furious.  The guys, unaware that she's  upset, celebrate.
Score!
They high five.  The doorman comes over with the upset  Girl and pulls the guys out.
What?  What's goin' on?  What's  your problem?
The road flies by as we PAN UP the front grill of a red  BMW to reveal Doug and Steve.  The car stops next to two  girls in a white Porshe.
We got some sweetness on the left.
Doug Turns UP the STEREO really loud so the car is  pounding.
(to the girls)  What's up?
(to the girls)  How you ladies doin' tonight?
The guys moving their mouths -- but the girls can't hear  them.
Turn your music down!
Yeah!  Just follow us!
You're a big stupid ass!
No.  You have beautiful eyes!
I like you too!
Go home, jerkoff!
Okay, we'll meet you there.
The light turns green.  Girls drive off.
A neon sign reads "ROXBURY."
A huge muscular BOUNCER, wearing a headset, guards the  roped off area.  Doug and Steve confidently strut past  the crowd.
Stop!
What's up?
Guys, this is the Roxbury.  No one  gets in unless you're on the list.
We're on the list.
Names?
Doug Butabi.
Steve Butabi.
You're brothers?
No...
They slowly turn to each other and bust.
... Yes!
They high five, laughing.
Quite a joke.
Doug is hilarious.
Yeah, I know.
Yeah, you ever hear this one?  You're not on the list.
Behind Steve and Doug, a '98 yellow FERRARI SCREECHES up  to the valet.  Car door opens and...
gets out.  Looking great, in an Armani suit, beautiful  supermodel accompanies him.
(beside himself)  Is that...?
It is.  The King of '21 Jump  Street.'  Richard Grieco.
Grieco quickly steps past Steve and Doug.
(aside to Doug)  Check the wheels.
Check the hottie.
The Bouncer jumps aside, letting them enter.  Richard  inadvertently rubs his nose as he enters.
Watching.  They both imitate his nose rub and try to  follow him in.  The Bouncer steps in front of them.
(yelling at Grieco  like they know him)  Alright, we'll see you later then!  (to Bouncer)  You know what?  We're gonna take  off now.
Maybe we'll hang out later.
There's no chance of that  happening.
Sounds good.
The guys exit.
The guys are driving.
You know what was wrong with that  place.
It's hard to say, since we didn't  get in.
It's just a poorly run operation.  They can't properly evaluate the  incoming clientele.
I thought we just didn't look cool  enough.
C'mon.  You?  You're a beautiful  man.  I tell you what I'd do if it  were my club.  I would treat all  the outside wannabes just as well  as any legendary former television  star.
That's pretty Roosevelt of you.
It's just what I believe in.
A police car drives behind them, turns on the SIREN.
The sound of the SIREN mixes with their MUSIC.
Must be the new dance mix version.
(loud speaker)  Pull over to the side of the road!
A female POLICE OFFICER signals them to pull over.
The officer steps up to their car.
You know you were doing fifty?
(yelling over radio)  What?
She reaches in, shuts OFF RADIO -- starts filling out  ticket.
This is a twenty-five mile an hour  zone.
Hottie cop likes you.
You serious?
You think she pulls over anybody?  Mave a move.
(turning to her)  What's going on?
Not much, I'm just giving you an  eighty dollar ticket.
She is so into you.
Can I see your license and  registration?
Steve pulls the documents off the sun visor, hands them  over.
(seductively)  I think I got what you're looking  for.
She takes it, walks back to police car.  Doug adjusts the rearview mirror.
She's on the radio.
She's calling her friends.
Seriously?
Here she comes.
How's my hair?
She hands Steve the papers and a ticket.
I want you to do me a favor.
Whatever you say, TJ Hooker.
Please obey any and all posted  speed limit signs.  Have a good  night.
It's already good, now that you've  served and protected me.
She laughs it off, walks away.  Doug takes the ticket.
Way to go, my friend.  You got her  badge number plus a month from now  you have a date to meet her at the  Municipal State Court.  Up top!
Score!
They high five and PEEL OUT.
This is a very downscale crowd, crappy cars, surrounding
Completely packed.  People are physically wedged up  against one another.
This is what it's all about.
A big SECURITY GUY plows through the area.
Folks, we got to keep this area  clear!
The crowd moves, sweeping the guys along.  Doug and Steve settle in a different spot.
There's a good feeling in here.
People, there's no lingering by  the exits!
As it moves, Doug is engulfed in the crowd and  disappears.
Doug?... Hey, Doug!... Whoa!
Steve is shoved away as the crowd moves again.
jumps up and pops his head above the crowd.
Steve!
is wedged into a corner.
Doug!
pops up near the entrance to the men's room.
Steve!
Doug!
Doug's face is wedged up against a mirror.  He struggles  to pull a cellular phone put of his pocket and dial.
Steve is wedged against a blinking light.  We hear a  cellular PHONE RING.  Steve reaches in his pocket and  pulls out his phone.
Hello?
Steve, it's Doug.
Oh, hey, Doug.  So, what's going on?
Not much.  Where are you?
I don't know.  Where are you?
Doug gets pushed up against a urinal.
There's a lot of guys pulling down  their pants, so it's either the  bathroom or the V.I.P room.  Meet  me back at the bar.  If I don't  make it, I'll see you tommorow at home.
DOUG hangs up.  O.S.  we hear someone UNZIP.
(panicked)  Hey, just hold on a second.
Doug moves away.
Two very bored club girls are standing up against a wall.
So, anyway, I'm standing there  waiting to use the pay phone...
Yeah, he was.  Seriously.
And this guy who's on the phone  turns around and tips his hat like  this.
DOUG does a "tip your hat" motion.
And who do you think the guy was?
Girls still stone-faced.
Emilio Estevez.
The Mighty Duckman.  Swear to God.  I was there.
(teasing)  Of course, you were.  You're the  one who yelled the breakfast  clubber's name.
I was like -- 'Emilioooo!'
So, anyway... you guys want to  make out or what?
The girls stare at them.
The guys pull up.  Doug gets out and starts to pump gas.
Score some chippage.  I'll meet  you in there.
Steve exits into the AM/PM.  Doug notices a woman puttng gas into her car.  She feins a smile, looks away.
Hey!
Doug starts pulling the pump in and out of the gas tank -- simulating copulation.  She's repulsed.
Steve looking at a bag of Pork Rinds.  Doug comes up from behind.
Hey, she's totally looking at you.
Who?
Doug motions toward the CASHIER.  She snaps her gum and  is reading People magazine.
Ask her where the chips are.
But, I know where they are.
DOUG pushes him.  Steve walks over to the Cashier.
Excuse me, I'm looking for the  potato chips.  You know, chips  made out of potato.
They're right behind you.
Wow, you really know what's going  on, don't you?
He turns away and pretends to look at the chips.  Doug  gives him a thumbs up.  Richard Grieco enters the store and walks up to the  Cashier.  She lights up, recognizing Grieco.
Steve, look.
Doug and Steve walk up to Grieco.
(trying to be cool)  Hey.
... Hey.
Remember us?  We were at the  Roxbury.
(to Grieco)  We were outside?
Grieco turns to Cashier.
Could I get a pack of Marlboro  Lights and that 12-pack of  Trojans.  Thanks.
Cashier rings it up,  hands it to him.
(obviously enamored)  Thanks.
Grieco exits, they all watch.  Steve approaches Cashier.
Yeah, I think I'm gonna need a 12-  pack of Trojans over there.
You know, they expire in two  years.
Doug and Steve watch Grieco's Ferrari drive off as they  sit on the car and eat Pork Rinds.
That nabob has got it going on.
(sadly envious)  Kickin' it at the Roxbury, rollin'  a banana Ferrari.
Tasty geisha by his side.
The man is a bag of chips.
(correcting him)  All that and a bag of chips.
Right.  Well, we're doing okay.  I  got a number tonight.
(thrilled)  Let me see it!
Steve hands him a cocktail napkin.  Doug reads it.
555...?  Steve, this isn't real.  It's one of those fake T.V.  numbers.
Is not.
Is, too.  I get this number all  the time.
At least she respected me enough  to write a fake number.  We'll get  a real one one of these days.
One of these days?  Steve, don't  you get it?  These are our days.  Now!  Today!  Ahora!
Ah whatta?
Doug jumps off the car, starts pacing.
Steve, we're young.  We're  supposed to purge ourselves of the  party virus or we'll just get so  clogged up that when we're like  forty we'll just explode.
Yeah, like one of those individual  plastic butters you get in the  diner.  You know, like when you  squish it, just bursts out all  over the place.
Steve makes explosion sound.
Forget the butter, Steve.  I'm  trying to explain --
(interrupting)  Or like when you put an egg in a  microwave and all the yellow stuff  flies out.
He mimes exploding egg.
That's an exceptional way to  visualize it but listen to me.
Oh!  Remember in camp when we put  that can of beans in the fire?
And it exploded.  Yes.  Steve!  If  we're ever going to live up to our  full potential, we've got to get  this partying out of our systems  now.
Let's do it.
They both get in the car.
Alright, let's do it!  Do it!  Woo!
... Do what?  Everything's closed.
Beat.
Then let's go home.
(excited)  Let's go home!  Wooo!
The house is a bad '80s combination of classical styles.

We PAN AROUND to see semi-juvenile furniture -- which is  overwhelmed by a huge stereo system.  Doug sleeps, mouth open.  A piece of red licorice reaches INTO FRAME and starts darting in and out of Doug's mouth. He coughs and waves it away.  The licorice starts going  up his nostril.  Doug wakes up.
Hey!  Knock it off!
Twizzled you, my friend.
Yeah, you totally got me.
STEVE laughs at this, starts eating the licorice.
That was in my nose.
Steve stops eating.
Two giant Great Danes plow through, knocking over plates. We meet their dad, KAMEHL BUTABI, fifties, Eugene Levi-  type, with some sort of Middle Eastern accent.
Captain!  Tenille!  Stop that!
Steve and Doug, in silk bathrobes, hair completely  disheveled, enter.
Look at this.  Barbara, look who's  honoring us with their presence.
We meet their mom, BARBARA BUTABI, well kept trophy wife. She tries to straighten out their hair.
Ma!... come on.
(handing Doug orange  juice)  Here...
(rejecting juice)  Mom, I'm trying to get my body to  enter the zone, so I can optimize  my fat-burning potential, and  orange juice does not help!
Doug, according to 'Fit for Life'  the idea of a balanced breakfast  is a fallacy.  Your body is only  prepared to accept one form of  food in the A.M. -- fruit.
Steve grabs the glass.
You can putrefy your insides if  you want to.  But, I'm having a  cup of cooked oatmeal, one  tablespoon protein power...
As Doug continues, Mr. Butabi gets more and more annoyed.
... and four soy sausage links.  (to Steve)  That's how you hit your peak.
(sarcastic)  Quick, Barbara, look at Doug.  He  is hitting his peak.  You don't  want to miss this.
Honey, if you're going to hit your  peak, do it in your room.
All I want for breakfast is some  sliced mangos and persimmons.
That's enough, you two.  Your  mother is not the maid.
No, can you tell the maid I want  some sliced mangos and persimmons?
I want you both at work in half an  hour.  And, Steve wear something  nice.  Emily's back from school.
Excuse me, Dad, but I think you're  confusing Steve for someone who  gives a flying rat's ass.
Wow, a flying rat's ass.  That  would be wild to see.
Kamehl, they'll be there.  Just  let them have their breakfast.
Sure.  Eat.  They need their  strength so they can stay out all  night for their dancing and their  orgies.
For your information, Dad, Doug  and I were not able to find an  orgy last night.

Barbara, explain something to me.  They graduate from high school and what  do they do?  Nothing.  Do they go  to college?  No.  Do they take any  intrest in my business?  No.  Do  they think about the future?  No.
Dad, if you know all the answers,  why do you keep asking the questions?
Half an hour.  I want to see your  dance club asses at the store.
Mr. Butabi exists.

"Staying Alive" by the BEE GEES.  Set of shoes walking, a la the opening of Saturday Night Fever.  We WIDEN to another set of shoes -- PAN UP to reveal Doug and Steve, strutting down the street like John Travolta.  Each holds a silk plant.

We see the guys pass.  They stop and hold up their cell  phone to the one in the window -- same way Travolta did  with the shoe.  A beautiful WOMAN walks by.  They turn to look at her  ass.  They run back and stand in front of her. She  pushes them aside.
Jerks.
She exits.  They continue.  They pass a cappucino  cart.
Single or double?
They look at each other to confirm their choice.
Double.
They walk with their iced cappucinos in bubble top cups  with straws.  MUSIC FADES.
Steve and Doug enter holding silk plants.  Mr. Butabi  walks up to them, takes the plants.  Doug is wearing a  Walkman.
Good.  Steve, you have a customer.  Doug, go ring that man up.
They both nod agreeably.  Steve exists.  Doug doesn't  move, still listening to the Walkman.  Mr. Butabi pulls  his walkman off and points at the register.  Doug exists.
Doug steps behind the counter, helping a COUPLE with seve
How will you be paying for this?  Cash, check or charge?
(pulling it out)  Charge.
(looking at it)  Visa, Mastercard, or Discover?
Move your thumb.
Doug moves it.
Oh... Visa.  Good one.
Doug makes a "you got me" motion.  He slides the card  through.
I think something's wrong with  your card.  You sure this is  yours?  'Cause it's not  processing.
It's my card.
I better call it in.
Doug calls.
Operator 238 please.
SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR, with headset, in front of computer, answers phone.
Authorization.  Card number?
What's up?
Doug, I told you not to call anymore.
I got to get an approval.
The card's fine.
Not the card, sweetness.  Me.
Shut up and swipe it.
I can go for that.
Doug swipes it through.
... that feel good?  'Cause I  could swipe it all night.
Doug keeps swiping it.  The couple looks at each other.
It's fine.  Good-bye.
She hangs up.  Doug happily hangs up.
(notices couple  still waiting)  ... Oh, can I help you with  something?
A middle-aged lady CUSTOMER is perusing.  Steve walks up.
Excuse me, may I show you around  the Silk Garden.  Home of a  wondrous variety of flora and  fauna -- all made of silk.
Are these supposed to be ferns?
That's what people will say.  But  guess what?
What?
(whispers in ear)  ... it's not real.  It's silk.  (acting in shock)  Oh, be careful!
What's wrong?
You've accidentally wandered into  the Enchanted Forest.  Allow me to  be your guide.
Steve ducks behind the four or five silk trees that make  up the "forest" and sticks his head out from between two  trees -- now wearing a safari hat.  He picks up a    wate
You know what I just did?
What?
I just watered your plant for a  whole year.
It's a show box on the register counter, cut up silk  flowers inside.  Doug is making two figures dance.
(male voice)  What's up?  You want to dance?  (female voice)  With you.  Oh, God, yes.
Doug slams the figures together, singing a dance song.  Mr. Butabi enters.
What are you doing?
Doug pulls the diorama away.
Not much.
You don't spend enough time in  dance clubs?  You have to cut up  my plants, and make toys of them?
This club had a jungle theme.
(calling off)  Carlos!  Come work the cash  register.  (to Doug)  You get your brother and load  the truck.
CARLOS, middle-aged assistant manager, steps behind  counter.  Doug grabs the diorama and exits.
Next door to "BUTABI'S SILK GARDEN" is "BRIGHT IDEA" lamp store.  Steve gingerly loads a tree into the store van.  Doug tosses his in.
Steve!  Steve!
Steve starts to turn.  Doug tries to stop him.
Don't look!
EMILY ANDERSON, a plain over-eager girl, early 20s,  bounces out of the lamp store, holding a CHANDELIER in  one hand that TINKLES every time she moves.
Hi, Steve.  Hey, Doug.
Hey, Emily.
(turning away)  Whatever.
So, I guess you're back from  school and working in the lamp  store again.
Yeah, I missed you.
Pardon me.  I got to talk to my  brother a second.
Doug pulls Steve aside.
What, do you like her or something?
No.
Then why are you talking to her?
She's talking to me.

Steve, look at me.  It is your  destiny to be with a variety of lady  girls.  Not just one lamp store  troll.  And quite frankly, your level  of looks is way above her level of  looks.  So for her own good, just  walk away.
You are so smart.
That's why I'm here.
So, Steve, you gonna ask me out  'cause I think we could have a really  good time...
Yeah, that sounds good.
Doug annoyed, steps between them.
Back off, chicklet!
What's your problem.  Doug?

Emily, I don't know if you know  this, but my brother and I?  We  live life in the fast lane.  That  means no stop signs, no red  lights, and no pulling over to  take pictures.  Now you see this  man over here?
Doug motions to Steve.
What's up?
He's my co-pilot on this magic  carpet ride.  It's a two-man  operation.  One -- two --  (points at Emily)  -- crowd.
Shut up, Doug.
Sh!  I just don't want you to get  hurt.
Their father walks over.
Emily!
Hi, Mr. Butabi.
Their father puts his arm around Steve.
You know my son, Steve, here,  likes you.
Dad, come on!
Doug, frustrated, walks away.  FRED ANDERSON, Emily's  overweight father, walks over, also holding a CHANDELIER  and TINKLING, puts his arm around Emily.
(gregarious)  Mr. Butabi, is Steve asking Emily  to marry him again?  Ha, ha.
Ha, ha, with the way they carry on, I  think they're already planning their  honeymoon, Mr. Anderson.
Ha.  Ha.  Did I tell you?  I've  already booked a wedding band.
Ha.  Ha.  Yes, and if they have  enough grandchildren we won't have to  hire salesmen anymore.  Ha, ha, ha...
Doug stands behind them and mocks laughing along with  them.
Kamehl, you kill me.
No, you kill me.  You murder me.
(as he walks away)  ... salesmen.  That's great.
Emily waves good-bye to Steve.
Dad, can you just leave Steve alone?
What?  Your brother likes the girl.
No, he doesn't.
No, I don't.
Dad, nothing personal, but Emily's  like a pigwoman from a planet of pig  people.  And she's trying to take  Steve on her porky little spaceship  so she can take him back to the  Planet Pig!
Hey, Doug, you know what they eat on  the Pig Planet?  Bacon and sausage.
(laughing)  Nice call.
They high five.
Every once in a while I'll hit pay  dirt.
This is all too bad, because that  girl is going to be his wife.
No, she's not.
(to Doug)  You know, they could also eat ham.

Enough of pig talk.  Doug, do you  see this wall?  When they marry,  we can knock it down.  Then  combine stores and have the first  plant/lamp store.  And Steve and  Emily can run it and it's up to  them if they want to keep you  around.
Are you seeing planes?  Is your  name Tatu?  Because I think you're  living on Fantasy Island.
God, that was a sweet show.
Yes, I have a fantasy.  That I  have two capable sons who listen  to me.  Look how you load the  truck.  You've done enough damage  for one day.  Get out of here.  I'm sick of both of you!
Their father slams the van closed and exits into the  store.
So, we're on a break?
I guess.
You want to Crunch it?
Sure, I'll Crunch.
of the cardiovascular room.  Long line of stairmasters,  treadmills, etc.  We PASS people working out.
What's up, Stacey?
STACEY rolls her eyes at them and turns away.
Patty, work it.
Shut up.
Ritchie, you're the man.
Fuck off.
The guys stop to look at a WOMAN on the inner thigh  machine.  She opens and closes her legs, notices them.
What?
They look back up and walk away.
Tom-meee!
Steve raises his hand to high five a bodybuilder, who  ignores them.
Catch you later.

A huge muscle guy is looking in the mirror as he pumps a  barbell.  Doug and Steve step over.  This is the first  time we see them, in their gym attire -- tight Spandex  pants, mesh tank tops and giant weight belts.
Excuse me, can the rest of us use  the mirror?
The muscle guy moves over.  Doug picks up a small    dumb
(pumps it)  How's my form?
Looking good.  Relax the  shoulders... breathe through it...  lift don't swing... feel the  burn... stitch in time... and let  me hear this one...
(screaming)  Aaaaaaaaah!
Steve joins in.
Aaaaaaaaaaaah!
Doug finishes, drops dumbbell.
Sweet pump.  Got some veinage  going.
Two girls walk over.
(whispers to Steve)  Ask me what time it is.
But I know what time it is.
Hotties.
Oh...  (loudly)  Excuse me, do you know what time  it is?
Sure, Let me check my watch.
Doug elaborately twists his arm to look at his watch --  flexing his triceps and displaying them to their full  advantage.
I... think it's... quarter three.
Doug stays unnaturally in that position till the girls  leave.  He relaxes.
Ladies love triceps.
CRAIG, an overenthusiastic trainer, steps up to them.
Doug!  Steve!  What's up?
Craig!
Looking large, gentlemen.  You  guys want the rest of my power  bar?
-- holding it up.
(holding it up)  No, we got a Nitro bar.
(holding it up)  How 'bout an Energy Booster Bar?
(holding it up)  No, we got a Muscle Triplicator  Bar.
Okay, but let me know if you need  some carbs.  I got a case of  'carbolicious' in the back.  But  supplements aside, can I get some  quality time with you fellas?
We're in between sets.  Lay it on.
How long we been friends?
All seven years of high school.

That's right.  That's why I got to be  real with you now.  And I'm not gonna  sugar coat it.  As a professional  trainer,  I'm a little worried about  your pecs.  You guys don't go all the  way down.  It's called full  extension.  And I'm not seeing it.
Craig, you're right.  We actually had  a long talk about that the other  night.
I just don't want you to cheat  yourselves.  I'm sorry I had to come  down on you like this, but in a weird  way, that's my job.
Hey, that's why we love you and we  hate you.
Still friends?
You know it.
I'm glad we had this talk.
Hey, we don't talk, we do.
They all nod.
A very fit AEROBICS TEACHER stands on a mini-stage.
Okay, everybody, I'm Shelley.  Are  you ready to Cardio-Funk?
Yeah!
No!... Yes!
Oh, man, you are hilarious.
They high-five.  MUSIC STARTS.  "MOVE YOUR BODY" by  Amber.
Okay!  Here comes the countdown!  Three... two... one!
PAN a line of aerobicizers.  Everyone is in synch --  except Doug and Steve, who work out chaotically.
... and kick!
Everyone kicks.  But, they continue their hyper dance.
... and reach.

Everyone reaches.  They continue being out of synch.  Suddenly, they stop, put fingers on their necks and stare up at a clock.  Simultaneously, they go right back into  their manical dance.  MUSIC ENDS.  Everyone but Doug and Steve stop.  People  stare at them.  They continue in silence, then slowly  wind down as they notice people staring.
Alright!  Yeah!
Cardio-funk!
Thank you, Shelley!
Shelley stares at them.  After a few uncomfortable beats.
... what's up?
Doug and Steve simultaneously put on their sunglasses.
Should we go back to work?
Probably.
What do you want to do?
We shaked it, let's bake it.
They walk off.
Guys drive along highway in BMW.  Ocean on one side.  Steve stares off at the ocean.
Water.
Where?
There.
Doug turns.
Right.
We see Steve and Doug, waist up.  They have lotion caked  up unevenly on themselves.
You know, I told Dad we should put  some ferns and some silk banana  trees in front of the store.  'Cause then passersby and the like  could see 'em and we could attract  more customers.
